channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Knowing What to Label for Few Shot Microscopy Image Cell Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we argue that the random selection of unlabelled training target images to be annotated and included in the support set may not enable an effective fine-tuning process, so we propose a new approach to optimise this image selection process.

item.title: GENIUS: Sketch-based Language Model Pre-training via Extreme and Selective Masking for Text Generation and Augmentation
item.description: We introduce GENIUS: a conditional text generation model using sketches as input, which can fill in the missing contexts for a given sketch (key information consisting of textual spans, phrases, or words, concatenated by mask tokens).

item.title: Multi-task Learning for Sparse Traffic Forecasting
item.description: For this reason, we propose a multi-task learning network that can simultaneously predict the congestion classes and the speed of each road segment.

item.title: Contrastive Positive Sample Propagation along the Audio-Visual Event Line
item.description: Visual and audio signals often coexist in natural environments, forming audio-visual events (AVEs).

item.title: DGD-cGAN: A Dual Generator for Image Dewatering and Restoration
item.description: Our Dual Generator Dewatering cGAN (DGD-cGAN) removes the haze and colour cast induced by the water column and restores the true colours of underwater scenes whereby the effects of various attenuation and scattering phenomena that occur in underwater images are tackled by the two generators.

item.title: GNS: A generalizable Graph Neural Network-based simulator for particulate and fluid modeling
item.description: The predictions are 5, 000x faster than traditional MPM simulations (2. 5 hours for MPM simulations versus 20 s for GNS simulation of granular flow).

item.title: Data-Adaptive Discriminative Feature Localization with Statistically Guaranteed Interpretation
item.description: We apply the proposed method to the MNIST dataset and the MIT-BIH dataset with a convolutional auto-encoder.

item.title: Model-based Causal Bayesian Optimization
item.description: We propose model-based causal Bayesian optimization (MCBO), an algorithm that learns a full system model instead of only modeling intervention-reward pairs.

item.title: Diagnostics for Deep Neural Networks with Automated Copy/Paste Attacks
item.description: Third, we compare this approach with other interpretability tools by attempting to rediscover trojans.

item.title: LVOS: A Benchmark for Long-term Video Object Segmentation
item.description: The videos in our LVOS last 1. 59 minutes on average, which is 20 times longer than videos in existing VOS datasets.

item.title: CITADEL: Conditional Token Interaction via Dynamic Lexical Routing for Efficient and Effective Multi-Vector Retrieval
item.description: In this paper, we unify different multi-vector retrieval models from a token routing viewpoint and propose conditional token interaction via dynamic lexical routing, namely CITADEL, for efficient and effective multi-vector retrieval.

item.title: Towards Explaining Subjective Ground of Individuals on Social Media
item.description: Large-scale language models have been reducing the gap between machines and humans in understanding the real world, yet understanding an individual's theory of mind and behavior from text is far from being resolved.

item.title: Ask4Help: Learning to Leverage an Expert for Embodied Tasks
item.description: Embodied AI agents continue to become more capable every year with the advent of new models, environments, and benchmarks, but are still far away from being performant and reliable enough to be deployed in real, user-facing, applications.

item.title: Look More but Care Less in Video Recognition
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose Ample and Focal Network (AFNet), which is composed of two branches to utilize more frames but with less computation.

item.title: Unsupervised 3D Pose Transfer with Cross Consistency and Dual Reconstruction
item.description: With $G$ as the basic component, we propose a cross consistency learning scheme and a dual reconstruction objective to learn the pose transfer without supervision.

item.title: Deep Gaussian Processes for Air Quality Inference
item.description: Accurate, fine-grained air quality (AQ) monitoring is essential to control and reduce pollution.

item.title: Contrastive Losses Are Natural Criteria for Unsupervised Video Summarization
item.description: Video summarization aims to select the most informative subset of frames in a video to facilitate efficient video browsing.

item.title: Language-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning to Solve Misunderstandings with Action Corrections
item.description: To evaluate our approach, we propose a collection of benchmark environments for action correction in language-conditioned reinforcement learning, utilizing a synthetic instructor to generate language goals and their corresponding corrections.

item.title: Let's Enhance: A Deep Learning Approach to Extreme Deblurring of Text Images
item.description: This work presents a novel deep-learning-based pipeline for the inverse problem of image deblurring, leveraging augmentation and pre-training with synthetic data.

item.title: Task Residual for Tuning Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large-scale vision-language models (VLMs) pre-trained on billion-level data have learned general visual representations and broad visual concepts.

item.title: Contrastive Knowledge Graph Error Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel framework - ContrAstive knowledge Graph Error Detection (CAGED).

item.title: A Persian ASR-based SER: Modification of Sharif Emotional Speech Database and Investigation of Persian Text Corpora
item.description: Speech Emotion Recognition (SER) is one of the essential perceptual methods of humans in understanding the situation and how to interact with others, therefore, in recent years, it has been tried to add the ability to recognize emotions to human-machine communication systems.

item.title: How to train your draGAN: A task oriented solution to imbalanced classification
item.description: The long-standing challenge of building effective classification models for small and imbalanced datasets has seen little improvement since the creation of the Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique (SMOTE) over 20 years ago.

item.title: Leveraging Multi-stream Information Fusion for Trajectory Prediction in Low-illumination Scenarios: A Multi-channel Graph Convolutional Approach
item.description: The optical flow channel is applied to capture the pattern of relative motion between adjacent camera frames and modelled by Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Network (ST-GCN).

item.title: Hyperbolic Sliced-Wasserstein via Geodesic and Horospherical Projections
item.description: It has been shown beneficial for many types of data which present an underlying hierarchical structure to be embedded in hyperbolic spaces.

item.title: Null-text Inversion for Editing Real Images using Guided Diffusion Models
item.description: Our Null-text inversion, based on the publicly available Stable Diffusion model, is extensively evaluated on a variety of images and prompt editing, showing high-fidelity editing of real images.

item.title: VeLO: Training Versatile Learned Optimizers by Scaling Up
item.description: While deep learning models have replaced hand-designed features across many domains, these models are still trained with hand-designed optimizers.

item.title: Features Compression based on Counterfactual Analysis
item.description: A small and interpretable Decision Tree is trained on the discretized dataset that is stable and robust.

item.title: SAR-based landslide classification pretraining leads to better segmentation
item.description: In the case of landslides, rapid assessment involves determining the extent of the area affected and measuring the size and location of individual landslides.

item.title: DiffusionDet: Diffusion Model for Object Detection
item.description: In inference, the model refines a set of randomly generated boxes to the output results in a progressive way.

item.title: I see you: A Vehicle-Pedestrian Interaction Dataset from Traffic Surveillance Cameras
item.description: The development of autonomous vehicles arises new challenges in urban traffic scenarios where vehicle-pedestrian interactions are frequent e. g. vehicle yields to pedestrians, pedestrian slows down due approaching to the vehicle.

item.title: Uni-Perceiver v2: A Generalist Model for Large-Scale Vision and Vision-Language Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we propose Uni-Perceiver v2, which is the first generalist model capable of handling major large-scale vision and vision-language tasks with competitive performance.

item.title: 3DLatNav: Navigating Generative Latent Spaces for Semantic-Aware 3D Object Manipulation
item.description: However, most models do not offer controllability to manipulate the shape semantics of component object parts without extensive semantic attribute labels or other reference point clouds.

item.title: UniFormerV2: Spatiotemporal Learning by Arming Image ViTs with Video UniFormer
item.description: UniFormer has successfully alleviated this issue, by unifying convolution and self-attention as a relation aggregator in the transformer format.

item.title: Towards Building Text-To-Speech Systems for the Next Billion Users
item.description: We open-source all models on the Bhashini platform.

item.title: RenderDiffusion: Image Diffusion for 3D Reconstruction, Inpainting and Generation
item.description: In this paper, we present RenderDiffusion as the first diffusion model for 3D generation and inference that can be trained using only monocular 2D supervision.

item.title: Cross-Modal Adapter for Text-Video Retrieval
item.description: However, as pre-trained models are scaling up, fully fine-tuning them on text-video retrieval datasets has a high risk of overfitting.

item.title: Why Deep Learning Generalizes
item.description: Very large deep learning models trained using gradient descent are remarkably resistant to memorization given their huge capacity, but are at the same time capable of fitting large datasets of pure noise.

item.title: Efficient Transformers with Dynamic Token Pooling
item.description: Transformers achieve unrivalled performance in modelling language, but remain inefficient in terms of memory and time complexity.

item.title: EfficientTrain: Exploring Generalized Curriculum Learning for Training Visual Backbones
item.description: The proposed method is inspired by the phenomenon that deep networks mainly learn to recognize some 'easier-to-learn' discriminative patterns within each example at earlier stages of training, e. g., the lower-frequency components of images and the original information before data augmentation.

item.title: Conffusion: Confidence Intervals for Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models have become the go-to method for many generative tasks, particularly for image-to-image generation tasks such as super-resolution and inpainting.

item.title: Structured Pruning Adapters
item.description: We propose Structured Pruning Adapters (SPAs), a family of compressing, task-switching network adapters, that accelerate and specialize networks using tiny parameter sets.

item.title: Self-supervised Trajectory Representation Learning with Temporal Regularities and Travel Semantics
item.description: TRL aims to convert complicated raw trajectories into low-dimensional representation vectors, which can be applied to various downstream tasks, such as trajectory classification, clustering, and similarity computation.

item.title: A Bird's-eye View of Reranking: from List Level to Page Level
item.description: Moreover, simply applying a shared network for all the lists fails to capture the commonalities and distinctions in user behaviors on different lists.

item.title: A Generalized Latent Factor Model Approach to Mixed-data Matrix Completion with Entrywise Consistency
item.description: Matrix completion is a class of machine learning methods that concerns the prediction of missing entries in a partially observed matrix.

item.title: Towards Automated Design of Bayesian Optimization via Exploratory Landscape Analysis
item.description: Bayesian optimization (BO) algorithms form a class of surrogate-based heuristics, aimed at efficiently computing high-quality solutions for numerical black-box optimization problems.

item.title: Abstractive Summarization Guided by Latent Hierarchical Document Structure
item.description: Sequential abstractive neural summarizers often do not use the underlying structure in the input article or dependencies between the input sentences.

item.title: UniSumm: Unified Few-shot Summarization with Multi-Task Pre-Training and Prefix-Tuning
item.description: The diverse demands of different summarization tasks and their high annotation costs are driving a need for few-shot summarization.

item.title: Monitoring machine learning (ML)-based risk prediction algorithms in the presence of confounding medical interventions
item.description: Monitoring the performance of machine learning (ML)-based risk prediction models in healthcare is complicated by the issue of confounding medical interventions (CMI): when an algorithm predicts a patient to be at high risk for an adverse event, clinicians are more likely to administer prophylactic treatment and alter the very target that the algorithm aims to predict.

item.title: Towards Good Practices in Evaluating Transfer Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Our evaluation reveals new important insights: 1) Transferability is highly contextual, and some white-box defenses may give a false sense of security since they are actually vulnerable to (black-box) transfer attacks; 2) All transfer attacks are less stealthy, and their stealthiness can vary dramatically under the same $L_{\infty}$ bound.
